newsitem.title: DUBAI: Saudi Arabia beheads Afghan man for drug smuggling.
newsitem.headline: Saudi Arabia beheads Afghan man for drug smuggling.

text.p: Saudi Arabia on Monday beheaded an Afghan man for smuggling drugs into the country, raising to 18 the number of people executed on drugs charges in the past two months.

An Interior Ministry statement carried by the official Saudi Press Agency said the man was beheaded in the western port city of Jeddah after being convicted of smuggling an unspecified amount of heroin into the kingdom.
The beheading brought to 62 the number of people put to death in the conservative Islamic country this year.
Saudi Arabia enforces Islamic sharia law by publicly beheading convicted murderers, rapists, drug smugglers and other criminals. It executed a total of 68 people in 1996.
